meanings.definition: To make a loud, long cry of pain or distress.
meanings.sent1: The injured dog yowed loudly in the night.
meanings.sent2: She yowed when she stubbed her toe on the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat yowed in protest when it was put in the bath.
meanings.sent4: The wind yowed through the trees like a ghostly wail.
meanings.sent5: The child yowed in fear when she saw the spider crawling towards her.

meanings.definition: Past tense of 'yow', meaning to cry out loudly.
meanings.sent1: He yowed for help after falling off his bike.
meanings.sent2: They yowed with joy when they won the game.
meanings.sent3: The baby yowed in excitement at the sight of balloons.
meanings.sent4: The sirens yowed in the distance, signaling an emergency.
meanings.sent5: The singer yowed the final note, leaving the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: A loud, long cry of pain or distress.
meanings.sent1: The yowed of the injured animal echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: She let out a yowed when she saw the spider on her arm.
meanings.sent3: The yowed of the baby could be heard from the next room.
meanings.sent4: The yowed of the wind sounded eerie in the empty house.
meanings.sent5: The yowed of the thunder shook the windows of the old cabin.
